items.content: Welcome! Today is our third lesson to get ready for your oral exam. Part of your exam is giving someone directions. Today we're going to practise this! We're going to start with some handy vocabulary and grammar, if you need a bit more help with this click on: "help please" to receive some handy tips. Then we're going to do a listening excersise. You'll listen to someone giving directions. If you struggle with this feel free to listen to the recording as often as you want. finally you're going to work with a classmate and practise giving eachother directions. Best of luck!
Read the text and do the excersises

crossing - oversteekplaats
bus stop - bushalte
crossroads - kruispunt
traffic - verkeer
traffic light - verkeerslichten
signpost - wegwijzers
street lights - straat verlichting
pavement - stoep
road - weg
square - plein
corner - straathoek
roundabout - rotonde

content.body:
1. The thing in the middle of a road that cars drive around is called a .
2. The place on the road where people can cross to the other side is called a .
3. The place where four roads meet is called a .
4. The object by the side of the road that shows a red or green light is called a .
5. The object near the pavement which shows the direction we should take is called a .
6. The things that make the street brighter at night are called .
7. The place near the road or in the park that people can walk along is called the .
8. The place that cars and buses drive along is called the .
9. The flat and empty area in the centre of town where people often meet is called the 10. The place where people stand to wait for their bus is called the .

questions.label: Write the best word or words to complete the definitions

items.content: Read the text and do the excersises

content.body:
(to follow) this road to the end.

(not to turn) left at the intersection.
(not to park) your car there!
(not to come) to work too late.
(to walk) straight ahead untill you reach the park.

(to tell) your manager if there's a problem

a. To listen to your teacher. - Listen you to your teacher. - Listen to your teacher.
b. Do run in the corridors. - Don't run in the corridors.- Don't to run in the corridors.
c. Please to be careful when you cross the street. - Please being careful when you cross the street. - Please be careful when you cross the street.
d. Helping your parents at home. - Help your parents at home. - To help your parents at home.
e. Don't worry if you make a mistake! - Don't to worry if you make a mistake! - Don't worrying if you make a mistake!

items.value: Don't to run in the corridors
Please to be careful when you cross the street.
Please being careful when you cross the street
Please be careful when you cross the street.
To help your parents at home.
Don't worry if you make a mistake!
Don't to worry if you make a mistake!
Don't worrying if you make a mistake!

prompt.body:
a. Play to nicely with other children.
b. Don't forgetting your homework.
c. Please you pass me a pencil.
d. Brushing your teeth every day.
e. Don't to make a mess!

values.value:
a. Play nicely with other children.
b. Don't forget your homework.
c. Please pass me a pencil.
d. Brush your teeth every day.
e. Don't make a mess.

b. Don't forget your homework.

items.content: Listen to the instructions and answer the questions.

content.body:
A. The speaker gives directions to the
B. The speaker gives directions to the
C. The speaker gives directions to the
D. The speaker gives directions to the

questions.label: Where is the speaker sending you?

content.body:
1. Go on.
2. past the traffic lights.
3. It's the building next to the library the left.
4. the roundabout turn left.
5. Then the first left on to Green Street.
6. Go the traffic lights and take the right on to King's Road

items.content:
Work with a classmate, you are at the interparking centrum, take turns at give eachother directions to:
A: The university
B: The Martini church
A: Holland Casino
B: The Groninger museum
A: The KFC
B: The Oosterpoort
